name: Wall Breaker (The Boss)
description:
My second experiment on hobby game development.

I miself quite like how it turned out - has that relaxing feel to it plus a litle brain stimuli (at least if you try to get a good "score") and is newer the same old, since nev level (user adjustable size) is random generated each time (and validated for being completable).

All graphics, level and a litle bit of sound, are code generated on the go, so it is very small.

The game automatically adjusts itself and the generated graphics to best match any screen resolution.

The goal is to get from left to the right with minimum amount of walls broken.

* Brick walls take one hit.

* Bars take two hits.

* Blue marker removes 3 hits from count, but cannot go bellow zero.

  Any leftover points will be counted towards "bonus" score.

* Bonus score will be given only if hitcount is zero when finishing ("clean run").

* "Clean run" is not possible on all levels.
